title: The Two Towers
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: A fanasty novel set in Middle-Earth.

title: The Return of the King
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: A fanasty novel set in Middle-Earth.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: A fanasty novel set in Middle-Earth.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Cixin Liu
description: Aliens from a nearby star system recieve a signal from earch and are sending an invasion fleet which will take 400 years to get to Earth.

title: The Dark Forest
author: Cixin Liu
description: Humainty is preparing to face the Alien threat.

title: Death's end
author: Cixin Liu
description: Mutually assured destruction has led to decades of peace between humainty and Trisolarins, but a new force is awakening and this delicate balance can no longer hold...

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's quest to avenge the whale that 'reaped' his leg.

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story about a poor oprhpan named Oliver Twist born in a workhouse.

title: Solaris
author: Stanislaw Lem
description: When Kris Kelvin arrives at the planet Solaris to study the ocean that covers its surface, he finds himself confronting a painful memory embodied in the physical likeness of a past lover.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J. D. Salinger
description: Holden narrates the story of a couple of days in his sixteen-year-old life, just after he's been expelled from prep school.

title: Foundation
author: Issac Asimov
description: For tweleve thousand years the Galactic Empire has ruled supreme. Now it is dying. But only Hari Seldon, creator of the revolutionary science of psychohistory, can see into the future - to a dark age of ignorance, barbarism, and warfare that will last thirty thousand years

title: I Robot
author: Issac Asimov
description: An adventure into a not-so-distant future where man and machine, struggle to redefine life, love, and consciousness - and where the stakes are nothing less than survival.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: Pip is a poor ophan, a boy without "expectations" being raised by his unkind sister and her blacksmith husband in a small home on the marshes of Kent.

title: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress
author: Robert A. Heinlein
description: It is a tale of revolution, of the rebellion of a former penal colony on the Moon against its masters on the Earth.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: Guy Montag is a fireman. His job is to destroy the most illegal of commodities, the printed book.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: Brave New World is a searching vision of an unequal, technologically-advanced future where humans are genetically bred, socially indoctrinated, and pharmaceutically anesthetized to passively uphold an authoritarian ruling order.

author: George Orwell
description: A masterpiece of rebellion and imprisonment where war is peace, freedom is slavery, and Big Brother is watching.

title: Anatomy of the State
author: Murry N. Rothbard
description: This gives a succinct account of Rothbard's view of the state.

title: The Communist Manifesto
author: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engles
description: The Communist Manifesto is a condensed and incisive account of the worldview Marx and Engles developed during their hetic intellectual and political collaboration.

title: The Wealth of Nations
author: Adam Smith
description: The foundation of modern economic though and remains the single most important account of the rise of, and the principles behind, modern capitalism.

title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philp K. Dick
description: It was January 2021, and Rick Deckard had a license to kill. Somewhere among the hordes of humans out there, lurked serveral rogue androids.

title: The Marian Chronicles
author: Ray Bradbury
description: The Martian Chronicles tells the story of humanity's repeated attempts to colonize the red planet.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
author: Ken Kesey
description: Tyrannical Nurse Ratched rules her ward in an Oregon State mental hospital with a strict and unbending routine, unopposed by her patients, who remain cowed by mind-numbing medication and the threat of electric shock therapy.

title: Undaunted Courage
author: Stephen E. Ambrose
description: In 1803 President Thomas Jefferson selected his personal secretary, Captain Meriwether Lewis, to lead a pioneeing voyage across the Great Plains and into the Rockeis.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet of Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the "spice" melange, a druge capable of extending life and enhancing consciousness.

title: No Longer Human
author: Osamu Dazai
description: No Longer Human tells the poignant and fascinating story of a young man who is caught between the breakup of the traditions of a northern Japanese aristocratic family and the impact of Western ideas.

title: All Quiet on the Western Front
author: Erich Maria Remarque
description: In 1914, a room full of German schoolboys, fresh-faced and idealistic, are goaded by their schoolmaster to troop off to the 'glorious war'.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A nineteenth-century boy from a Mississippi River town recounts his adventures as he travels down the river with a runaway slave.

title: The Hobbit
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: A fanasty novel set in Middle-Earth.

title: Death's end
author: Cixin Liu
description: Mutually assured destruction has led to decades of peace between humainty and Trisolarins, but a new force is awakening and this delicate balance can no longer hold...
